entry.title: The importance of social networks for innovation and productivity
entry.summary: Social networks facilitate the diffusion of ideas across individuals and firms, and because of this, they play an important role in productivity growth. In this post we explain how this works.

entry.title: Food production is responsible for one-quarter of the world’s greenhouse gas emissions
entry.summary: One-quarter of the world’s greenhouse gas emissions result from food and agriculture. What are the main contributors to food’s emissions?

entry.title: What are the environmental impacts of food and agriculture? Introducing our new Our World in Data series
entry.summary:
Feeding the world whilst reducing food’s impact on the environment is one of our greatest challenges in the coming decades.
What are food’s environmental impacts?

entry.title: How do CO2 emissions compare when we adjust for trade?
entry.summary: CO2 emissions are typically measured in terms of ‘production’. But how do emissions compare when we adjust for trade? Which countries export the most CO2 and which offshore their emissions?

entry.title: Where in the world do people emit the most CO2?
entry.summary: There are large inequalities in the carbon footprint of people across the world. How do countries across the world compare? Where in the world do people emit the most CO2?

entry.title: Who emits the most CO2 today?
entry.summary: Which countries emit the most CO2 today? How do annual emissions vary across the world?

entry.title: Who has contributed most to global CO2 emissions?
entry.summary: There’s not only significant variability in how much CO2 countries emit across the world today. There are also large differences in how much each has emitted in the past. Who has contributed most to global CO2 since 1750?

entry.title: The history of Our World in Data
entry.summary: Our World in Data has been a project many years in the making. Here we detail the history of how the project got started, its evolution over the years and where we are today as a team.

entry.title: 12 key metrics to understand the state of the world
entry.summary: At Our World in Data we present data and research – across more than 3000 charts – on the world’s largest problems. But some metrics are core to our work: here we present 12 that are key to understanding the state of the world.
